thread.title: Soccerway's betting guide hits another stat-based accumulator
thread.title_full: Soccerway's betting guide hits another stat-based accumulator

title: Soccerway's betting guide hits another stat-based accumulator
text:
0 Jan 9, 2017 16:25:21 For the third time in the last 10 weeks, followers of Soccerway's weekly betting guide profited from another winning accumulator as AC Milan completed a 10/1 success 
Accumulators are often a significant part of an online bettor's approach. They're hit and miss of course, that's only natural when taking a big price about several selections all coming in on the same week but Soccerway have been in fine form recently and their members have benefited spectacularly. 
Their weekly betting guide picked out another winning five-fold, this time at 10/1 (11.0). All of the recommendations were stats-based selections uncovered by the best betting minds behind the site and delivered free to thousands of members. The latest winning multiple including picks from the FA Cup, La Liga, Serie A and the Primera Liga. 
Regular readers will know this isn't a one-off; it's the third such bet to land for the guide in just 10 weeks. The previous two both paying just over 9/1 (10.0) at the advised odds. Have you signed up to ensure you're in line to receive the next instalment before anyone else? 
Registering is quick, simple and most importantly, free. You'll then get a copy of each new edition via email as soon as it's released and punters who followed last week's selections had a very good few days indeed. 
A total of six bets proved correct. They included Roma (10/11) , Bradford to win to nil (8/5) , Bristol Rovers (Evens) and Scunthorpe to win and both teams to score (11/5). 
The anytime angles column also picked out a winner as Sporting's Bas Dost continued his prolific form, netting twice, the 27-year-old was 4/5 (1.80) to get on the scoresheet. 
The five-fold capped what was a very profitable edition. Had you placed £10 on each of the highlighted selections at the advised prices then they'd have returned a profit of over £75. 
The team use the on-site tools to unearth where the value lies including head-to-head records, recent form and goal time analysis while Opta's latest statistics add another layer of statistical analysis. 
All this is available free to Soccerway members every week. Why not sign up now to ensure that Edition 17 is sent directly to your inbox? Related
